discussion.content:
Which two commands or commands sequences configures a switch so that if tags native VLAN 3839? (Choose two.)
A. interface GigabitEthernet0/0 
description to HR Building M 6490-406 
swithport trunk native vlan 3839 
B. interface GigabitEthernet0/0 
description to HR Building M 6490-406 
encapsulation dot1q tag vlan native 3839 
C. switch(config)#set switch native vlan 3839 
D. switch(config)#vlan dot1q native vlan 3839 
E. switch(config)#vlan dot1q tag native

Correct Answers A E

questions.answer_description:
When using auxiliary VLANs, the switch connected to the phone provides the VLAN to the phone. IP telephones typically have a built in 3-port 10/100 hub. One port internally attaches to the phone, one port is attached to the switch access port, and the other is used to connect to the workstation. The PC attached to the switch port via the IP phone is unaware of the presence of the phone
Objective:

Layer 2 Technologies -
Sub-Objective:

Configure and verify VLANs -
References:
Cisco > Home > Products and Services > Cisco Interfaces and Modules > Cisco Network Modules > Product Literature > Data Sheets > Cisco Catalyst 6500

Series Switches -
Cisco > Cisco IOS Interface and Hardware Component Command Reference > squelch through system jumbomtu > switchport voice vlan

discussion.content:
Answer is B
 the switch connected to the phone provides the VLAN
The switch provide the VLAN through CDP (For Cisco Phone), or through the LLDP standard protocol

choices.D: a VMPS server provides the VLAN for the switch and phone B
choices.B: the switch connected to the phone provides the VLAN
choices.C: the PC attached to the phone provides the VLAN information
choices.A: the administrator configures the phone with CLI

questions.question_text: When using auxiliary VLANs, how is a phone configured with the appropriate VLAN to join?

discussion.content: CE is the answer. PVST+ is the deault for cisco
Beginning from Cisco IOS 15.2(4)E release, the STP default mode is Rapid PVST+
C E - B doesn't make any sense

PVST+ is the default on cisco. You'll likely never see PVST in action.
Two things essentially differentialte PVST from PVST+
1 - PVST+ runs an extra instance without a vlan tag thus providing backwards compatibility with the IEEE802.1 standard implementetation.
2 - PVST only supports ISL trunking.
I agree with DimS: answers are C E

Why is B not E?
PVST+â€”This spanning-tree mode is based on the IEEE 802.1D standard and Cisco proprietary extensions. It is the default spanning-tree mode used on all Ethernet port-based VLANs. The PVST+ runs on each VLAN on the switch up to the maximum supported, ensuring that each has a loop-free path through the network. 
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/lan/catalyst2960/software/release/12-2_52_se/configuration/guide/2960scg/swstp.pdf

choices.D: The spanning-tree operation mode for this switch is IEEE/
choices.A: The spanning-tree mode stp ieee command was entered on this switch
choices.E: the spanning-tree operation mode for this switch is PVST+.
choices.C: The switch is operating in the default cisco spanning-tree mode.
choices.B: The spanning-tree operation mode for this switch is PVST.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer the exhibit. Which two statements about the spanning-tree operation of this switch are true? (Choose two.)

choices.F: LACP port-priority is used in the hashing algorithm to load-balance links within an EtherChannel. AC
choices.B: To manually configure a link within an EtherChannel to come up first, set its lacp port-priority value higher than the default.
choices.D: The system uses the port priority of the local and remote devices to determine which links in an EtherChannel group are hot-standby.
choices.C: The system uses the port priority of the local and remote devices to determine which links in an EtherChannel group are active.
choices.A: To manually configure a link within an EtherChannel to come up first, set its lacp port-priority value lower than the default.
choices.E: It determines which links in an EtherChannel group are active.

questions.question_text: Which two statements about the LACP port priority of a device are true? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
But another Cisco document has nuance:

"If a secure MAC address is secured on a port, that MAC address is not allowed to enter on any other port off that VLAN. If it does, the packet is dropped unnoticed in the hardware. Other than through the interface or port counters, you do not receive a log message reflecting this fact. Be aware that this condition does not trigger a violation. Dropping these packets in the hardware is more efficient and can be done without putting additional load on the CPU."

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/lan/catalyst4500/12-2/31sg/configuration/guide/conf/port_sec.pdf

choices.C: when the same MAC addresses enters a port more than once
choices.A: when sticky MAC address learning is enabled and the port has a link-down condition
choices.D: when the CAM table overflows with dynamically learned MAC addresses
choices.B: when a port with a secure MAC address attempts to use a different port in the same VLAN
choices.E: when the port has received more MAC addresses than allowed

questions.question_text: In which two circumstances does a port security violation occur? (Choose two.)
